job_tasks.phrase: operating our Data Centers' Network using modern DevOps tools, automation and classic administration methods.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core responsibility of managing and operating network infrastructure, which falls under traditional software engineering tasks related to system operation and maintenance.

job_tasks.phrase: responsible for hardware, network operating systems and services
job_tasks.justification: This indicates responsibility for the foundational components of the network infrastructure, aligning with system administration and engineering tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: work (remotely) on our production services as well as our high-performance machine-learning clusters
job_tasks.justification: While mentioning machine-learning clusters, the context is about operating the network infrastructure that supports them, not developing or managing the ML models themselves. This fits within the broader scope of system engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Configure, maintain and monitor the network environment using our automation stack
job_tasks.justification: This is a direct description of network administration and operational tasks, which are part of core software engineering responsibilities for maintaining infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: Maintain, improve and extend our automation stack (Golang, Templating)
job_tasks.justification: This task involves managing and enhancing the tools and scripts used for automation, which is a key aspect of DevOps and MLOps for infrastructure management.

job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to the ongoing renewal and optimization of our sites according to our architectural plans
job_tasks.justification: This refers to site infrastructure development and optimization, which is a system engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Troubleshooting physical and logical networking issues on routers, switches and Linux hosts
job_tasks.justification: This is a core network engineering and system administration task focused on diagnosing and resolving infrastructure problems.

job_tasks.phrase: Working with multiple hardware vendors and a world-class, high-performance environment
job_tasks.justification: This describes interaction with hardware and environments, which is part of managing and maintaining infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: Coordinate the work of remote hands in our Data Centers
job_tasks.justification: This involves managing on-site operational tasks, which falls under infrastructure management.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with team members on larger work
job_tasks.justification: This is a general collaboration task within a technical team, fitting under software development and integration.
This relates to operational responsibilities for maintaining system availability, a common task in software engineering roles.

job_tasks.phrase: help us break down language barriers.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase suggests a broader company mission related to language, but in the context of a network engineer, it implies enabling the infrastructure that supports such a mission, rather than directly working on language processing.

job_tasks.phrase: work in close partnership with your team, the wider DevOps team and the Engineering department
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions collaboration with various teams.

job_tasks.phrase: you will join a team of broadly skilled engineers who will be able to support and kick-start your projects.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights teamwork and mutual support within the engineering team.

job_tasks.phrase: Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities.
job_tasks.justification: This emphasizes working within a diverse and global team environment.

job_tasks.phrase: Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
job_tasks.justification: This directly addresses the importance of open communication, feedback, and collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.
job_tasks.justification: This indicates a strong emphasis on continuous learning and professional development.

job_tasks.phrase: Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.
job_tasks.justification: This encourages initiative, passion projects, and creativity, aligning with innovation and ownership.

soft_skills.justification: This explicitly mentions collaboration with various teams.

soft_skills.justification: This highlights teamwork and mutual support within the engineering team.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement clearly describes a Network Engineer role. The primary responsibilities involve operating, maintaining, and troubleshooting network infrastructure, hardware, and operating systems. While it mentions 'high-performance machine-learning clusters', the role's focus is on the network supporting these clusters, not on the AI/ML models themselves. The tasks fall squarely within Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), with specific emphasis on 1.A.1 (Software Development & Integration) and 1.A.2 (Operations & MLOps). There are no tasks related to AI/ML model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, or RAG (Macro-Category B). Therefore, the most appropriate profile is 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the role being a Network Engineer. The responsibilities and technologies mentioned are consistent with this role and do not indicate any AI/ML development or specialization. The distinction between supporting ML clusters and working on ML models is clear.
